Activity: Arrive at the office, settle in, and grab a cup of coffee. Check emails for any urgent requests or updates regarding the EHR collection and influenza trend analysis project.
Review the week's goal: abstracting data from the 2023-2024 influenza season, prioritizing electronic records. Target is 200 records per week with @mrs-2 (Grace Ito).
Begin abstracting data from electronic health records (EHRs) related to the 2023-2024 influenza season. Focus on identifying relevant patient records in the EHR system.

Develop an initial data extraction template including all the fields related to the seasonal influenza, e.g. Date of diagnosis, symptoms, vaccination status, lab results (influenza A/B), treatment, comorbidities.
Continue data abstraction from EHRs, focusing on accurately recording relevant information into the data extraction template. Aim to complete the abstraction of 25 EHRs.
Lunch Break - Head to the local cafe for a quiet lunch and some time to relax.
Resume data abstraction from EHRs. Focus on maintaining data quality and accuracy. Complete abstraction of another 25 EHRs.
Review the extracted data for any inconsistencies or missing information. Refine the abstraction process as needed.
Prepare a brief summary report on the progress made today, including the number of records abstracted and any challenges encountered. Share with @mrs-2 (Grace Ito).
Respond to some emails that I missed in the morning, and prepare the list for the things I want to finish tommorrow.
Wrap up work for the day and head home.
